text: Hi, I am facing an issue in module.js when I am writing custom javaScript. So this script is not working but when I attached a js file of this code then it works perfectly.

Hello everyone, I am trying to trouble shooting a weird behaviour of the sticky form in the page below. It went disappeared when scrolling to the bottom. How does it happened and how can I make it non-disappeared?

Thank you in advance for your time and answers.
<https://www.realtimenetworks.com/request-a-demo-and-pricing-from-realtimenetworks?hs_preview=AvItbmWx-41307999641>
Your css and js combo are pretty jacked. Honestly I’d use `position: sticky` instead. The whole js sticky thing is a little janky

i’ve encountered this before and it can be a couple of things.
•  scoping issues
• dependency / order issues (js files may get called before a dependency)

yes! look at the datetime filters
try <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#between-times|between_times> filter combined with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#unixtimestamp|unix_time_stamp> function
